stories.text:
I had an interview with a company based on US, for a position of senior full stack developer. He gave some questions related to my current role as senior developer. More or less here's the topic:

- explaining my work experience - how I manage or assign tasks to my subordinate - what is a leader means to me - how do I handle my subordinate mistakes / misdemeanor - how is the situation in my company and how can I do to change it

Then I had another interview with different company, they go with more technical questions here:

- asks to share some code I can show and explain to them - about how I manage css - about ci/cd pipeline - about react hooks

Now I think there are some project management role in the first one and infra / devops role in the second one (I'm more inclined towards this one). So what is the company really expect me to able to?
stories.title: Ask HN: What are companies expectation to a senior software developer?

stories.text:
I was wondering today ..what with all the noise about social media and dopamine addiction ..why not use the dopamine hits from Insta or FB clicks as a therapeutic way for depression or other mild brain chemical imbalance issues.

Some behavioural or depressive states can be resolved with talk therapy. A trained therapist can help people navigate with social media as therapy and gently nudge the patient back into health so it doesn’t slip into negative territory.

Or is this already done/implemented? If attention seeking is a way to get the dopamine hits, why not use it as a guided healing modality?

I am not sure I buy the theory that social media is all bad. Some people have come out of their shell and gain friends and have had a net positive experience. They used to say this with video gaming too back when…but surely all them kids didn’t turn out to be suicidal or anti social thugs?
stories.title: Using Social Media(with talk therapy) as cheap hack for dopamine therapy
